Description: Glazed composition amuletic figure of Qebhsenuef: mummiform falcon-headed Qebhsenuef is moulded in the round from turquoise blue glass with details of his long striped wig and facial features picked out in black. He holds against his body a long folded cloth. The back pillar, which runs from the end of his wig to the plinth on which he stands, is pierced through its width behind his shoulders and behind his feet so that the amulet might be attached to mummy wrappings.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Dr Joseph John Acworth
Curator's comments: Bibliography: 'Egyptian Treasures' (Shanghai, 1999), 148-150 No 45; C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994), p.46.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 2000 / Egyptian Treasures from the British Museum (p.125)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Marion Whiteford Acworth JP
